caption:
The photograph depicts a statue of King Kamehameha I, standing on a white pedestal. The statue is shown in a prominent and heroic pose, with one arm raised high, holding what appears to be a spear, while the other hand holds a cloak draped around his shoulders. The figure is adorned with a traditional feather helmet and cloak, indicative of Hawaiian royalty.

Located on the base of the statue is a large plaque that bears the inscription "KAMEHAMEHA" in bold letters, emphasizing the significance of the figure depicted. The base also displays an elaborate bronze relief panel that seems to depict a scene relevant to Hawaiian culture or perhaps a specific event in Kamehameha's life; it features palm trees and undulating terrain.

The background reveals the exterior of an imposing, colonial-style building with large balconies and arches that suggest a setting of official importance, likely a governmental or historically significant structure. A few clouds are visible in the sky, indicating partly cloudy weather, and a vintage car is seen parked in the vicinity, adding a mundane, everyday life aspect to the otherwise grand depiction.

Overall, the composition of the photo captures a blend of historical reverence in a setting that integrates elements of both past and contemporary elements.
title: Statue of King Kamehameha the Great who ruled Hawaii from 1795 to 1819.
